description: From an alteration (perhaps due to giggle) of snigger, itself a variant of snicker.

verbs.description: sniggle (third-person singular simple present sniggles, present participle sniggling, simple past and past participle sniggled)

examples: Ay! you see you'll laugh at the bare thought on it — and I'll be bound th' minister, though he's not a laughing man, would ha' sniggled at th' notion of falling in love wi' the child.

description: See snig (“a kind of eel”) +‎ -le (frequentative verbal suffix).

verbs.description: sniggle (third-person singular simple present sniggles, present participle sniggling, simple past and past participle sniggled)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To fish for eels by thrusting a baited hook into their dens.

verbs.description: sniggle (third-person singular simple present sniggles, present participle sniggling, simple past and past participle sniggled)

entries.meaning: (obsolete) To steal something of little value.
